alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Kimball; Morrill (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 6:45PM CDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Cheyenne, eastern Kimball and south central Morrill Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 545 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Potter, moving northeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Potter. This includes Interstate 80 in Nebraska between mile markers 35 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM MDT for the Panhandle of Nebraska.
